intro: Crotalaria oocarpa subsp. microcarpa, commonly known as the small-seeded velvet bean, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family Fabaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers followed by pod-like fruits containing small, dark seeds. It is a perennial shrub that thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed soils. Due to its ability to fix nitrogen, it plays a role in soil enrichment and is sometimes used in agricultural systems.
